message.content:
Below is one worked‐through solution showing how to account for all 13 pieces, match their orientations exactly as in the dictionary, and assemble them in a sensible order.

────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
1)  DESCRIPTION OF THE TARGET STRUCTURE
────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
•  Total Blocks & Layers  
   – The build consists of two separate sub‐structures for a total of 13 blocks.  
   – The main “pyramid‐rocket” structure has 3 layers (11 blocks).  
   – A smaller arch‐and‐wedge structure to the right has 2 blocks.  

•  Main Structure (3 layers, 11 blocks)  
   1.  Base Layer (5 blocks):  
       – Far‐left orange wedge  
       – Yellow cube  
       – Red arch (large circular opening in front)  
       – Yellow cube  
       – Far‐right orange wedge  
   2.  Second Layer (2 blocks):  
       – Green cube (left)  
       – Blue cube (right)  
   3.  Top Layer (4 orange wedges forming a square pyramid “roof”)  

•  Smaller Structure (2 blocks)  
   – One red arch in a different orientation than the main arch  
   – One orange wedge as a small “roof” on top  

────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
2)  SELECTING BLOCKS FROM THE DICTIONARY
────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
Below are the exact dictionary indices (and colors/orientations) needed.  
Remember, the same index may be used more than once, provided each piece is used in the same orientation shown in the dictionary.

•  Red Arch Blocks  
   – Index 1 (short red arch) → used once (center of main structure base).  
   – Index 2 (red arch, oriented “deeper” front‐to‐back) → used once (small structure).  

•  Colored Cubes  
   – Index 7 (blue cube) → 1 ×  
   – Index 8 (green cube) → 1 ×  
   – Index 9 (yellow cube) → 2 ×  

•  Orange Wedges  
   – Index 13 (slope oriented one way) → 2 × (base left wedge + top left wedge)  
   – Index 14 (mirror slope) → 2 × (base right wedge + top right wedge)  
   – Index 15 (front‐to‐back slope) → 2 × (top front wedge + small structure roof)  
   – Index 16 (back‐to‐front slope) → 1 × (top back wedge)  

In total: 13 pieces.

────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
3)  STEP‐BY‐STEP ASSEMBLY ORDER
────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
Below is one possible sequence.  Use the blocks exactly as shown (no rotation beyond what is in the dictionary):

{
  Step1:  Move block with index 13  // base left orange wedge
  Step2:  Move block with index 9   // base left yellow cube
  Step3:  Move block with index 1   // main red arch (short arch)
  Step4:  Move block with index 9   // base right yellow cube
  Step5:  Move block with index 14  // base right orange wedge
  Step6:  Move block with index 8   // second layer green cube
  Step7:  Move block with index 7   // second layer blue cube
  Step8:  Move block with index 13  // top left orange wedge
  Step9:  Move block with index 14  // top right orange wedge
  Step10: Move block with index 15  // top front orange wedge
  Step11: Move block with index 16  // top back orange wedge
  Step12: Move block with index 2   // red arch for small side structure
  Step13: Move block with index 15  // orange wedge for small side structure roof
}

Following that procedure (and placing each wedge/cube/arch in the same orientation shown in the dictionary images) reproduces the target scene exactly.
